trans-unit.source: Represents a selection control with a drop-down list that can be shown or hidden by clicking the arrow on the control.
The ComboBox allows the user to select an item from a drop-down list or optionally to enter new text in the text box of the control.
ComboBox is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl>, which means it can contain a collection of objects of any type (such as string, image, or panel).
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> class.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsEditable%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsReadOnly%2A> properties specify how the ComboBox behaves when the user does one of the following: - Enters a string to select an item in the ComboBox.
- Enters a string that does not correspond to an item in the ComboBox.
- Selects part of the string that is in the text box.
- Copies or pastes a value into the text box.

The following table describes the actions the user can and cannot take, depending on the values of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsEditable%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsReadOnly%2A>.
- Cannot enter a string that does not correspond to an item in the ComboBox.
- Can select part of the string in the ComboBox text box.
- Can copy the string in the ComboBox text box, but cannot paste a string into the ComboBox text box.|- Can select an item in the ComboBox by entering a string.
- Can enter a string that does not correspond to an item in the ComboBox.
- Can select part of the string in the ComboBox text box.
- Can copy or paste the string in the ComboBox text box.| |<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsEditable%2A> is `false`|- Can select an item in the ComboBox by entering a string.
- Cannot enter a string that does not correspond to an item in the ComboBox.
- Cannot select part of the string in the ComboBox.
- Cannot copy or paste the string in the ComboBox.|- Can select an item in the ComboBox by entering a string.
- Cannot enter a string that does not correspond to an item in the ComboBox.
- Cannot select part of the string in the ComboBox.

- Cannot copy or paste the string in the ComboBox.| The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsReadOnly%2A> property has an effect only if <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsEditable%2A> is `true`.
The ComboBox is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl>, so it can display content other than simple strings.
For example, you can create a ComboBox that contains a list of images.
When you have content other than strings in the ComboBox, a nonsensical string might appear in the ComboBox when the drop-down list is hidden.

To display a string in the ComboBox when it contains non-string items, use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextSearch.Text%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextSearch.TextPath%2A?displayProperty=fullName>attached property.
Customizing the ComboBox Control To apply the same property settings to multiple ComboBox controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To see the parts and states that are specific to the ComboBox, see [ComboBox Styles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the control’s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
> [!NOTE] > Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in ComboBox control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](../Topic/Customizing%20the%20Appearance%20of%20an%20Existing%20Control%20by%20Creating%20a%20ControlTemplate.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox"></xref> class.
Occurs when the drop-down list of the combo box closes.
To be added.
Occurs when the drop-down list of the combo box opens.
To be added.
Creates or identifies the element used to display the specified item.
The element used to display the specified item.
Gets a value that indicates whether a combo box supports scrolling.

If the control has a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer> in its style and has a custom keyboard scrolling behavior, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox.HandlesScrolling%2A> should return `true`.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox"></xref> supports scrolling; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox"></xref> has focus.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox"></xref> has focus; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the drop-down for a combo box is currently open.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the drop-down is open; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsDropDownOpen*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value that enables or disables editing of the text in text box of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox"></xref>.

The IsEditable and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsReadOnly%2A> properties specify how the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> behaves when the user does one of the following: - Enters a string to select an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
- Enters a string that does not correspond to an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
- Selects part of the string that is in the text box.
- Copies or pastes a value into the text box.
The following table describes the actions the user can and cannot take, depending on the values of IsEditable and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsReadOnly%2A>.
- Cannot enter a string that does not correspond to an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
- Can select part of the string in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> text box.

- Can copy the string in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> text box, but cannot paste a string into the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> text box.|- Can select an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> by entering a string.
- Can enter a string that does not correspond to an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
- Can select part of the string in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> text box.

- Can copy or paste the string in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> text box.| |IsEditable is `false`|- Can select an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> by entering a string.
- Cannot enter a string that does not correspond to an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
- Cannot select part of the string in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
- Cannot copy or paste the string in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.|- Can select an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> by entering a string.
- Cannot enter a string that does not correspond to an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
- Cannot select part of the string in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.

- Cannot copy or paste the string in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.| When IsEditable is equal to `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> uses a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentPresenter> to display the currently selected item; when IsEditable is equal to `true`, a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBox> is used for this purpose instead.
Note that a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBox> only displays plain text, and that a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBoxItem> may include non-plain text content, such as images.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox"></xref> can be edited; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsEditable*> dependency property.
To be added.
Determines if the specified item is (or is eligible to be) its own `ItemContainer`.
Specified item.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the item is its own `ItemContainer`; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that enables selection-only mode, in which the contents of the combo box are selectable but not editable.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsEditable%2A> and IsReadOnly properties specify how the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> behaves when the user does one of the following: - Enters a string to select an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
- Enters a string that does not correspond to an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
- Selects part of the string that is in the text box.
- Copies or pastes a value into the text box.
The following table describes the actions the user can and cannot take, depending on the values of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsEditable%2A> and IsReadOnly.
- Cannot enter a string that does not correspond to an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
- Can select part of the string in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> text box.

- Can copy the string in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> text box, but cannot paste a string into the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> text box.|- Can select an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> by entering a string.
- Can enter a string that does not correspond to an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
- Can select part of the string in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> text box.

- Can copy or paste the string in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> text box.| |<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsEditable%2A> is `false`|- Can select an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> by entering a string.
- Cannot enter a string that does not correspond to an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
- Cannot select part of the string in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
- Cannot copy or paste the string in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.|- Can select an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> by entering a string.
- Cannot enter a string that does not correspond to an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
- Cannot select part of the string in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.

- Cannot copy or paste the string in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.| When <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsEditable%2A> is equal to `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> uses a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentPresenter> to display the currently selected item; when <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsEditable%2A> is equal to `true`, a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBox> is used for this purpose instead.
Note that a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBox> only displays plain text, and that a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBoxItem> may include non-plain text content, such as images.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox"></xref> is read-only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsReadOnly*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets whether the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.SelectionBoxItem*> is highlighted.
This property is a dependency property.
However, the dependency property identifier field for IsSelectionBoxHighlighted is not public.

Therefore, you cannot use the backing dependency property for property system operations that require the dependency property identifier, such as calls to <xref:System.Windows.DependencyObject.GetValue%2A>.
However, you can still use IsSelectionBoxHighlighted as a property trigger.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.SelectionBoxItem*> is highlighted; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the maximum height for a combo box drop-down.
Auto sizing is not the default, and will result in the drop down size potentially exceeding the available size in the parent element.
This is not typically desirable.

## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` - or – - or - ``` ## XAML Values *double* String representation of a value.
This is interpreted as a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-dipixel-md.md)] measurement.
Strings need not explicitly include decimal points.
For instance a value of `1` is acceptable.
The same <xref:System.Double> range restrictions as mentioned in the Property Value section apply.
*qualifiedDouble* A *double* value as described above, followed by one of the following unit declaration strings: `px`, `in`, `cm`, `pt`.

`px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] `in` is inches; 1in==96px `cm` is centimeters; 1cm==(96/2.54) px `pt` is points; 1pt==(96/72) px `Auto` Enables autosizing behavior.
See Remarks.
A double that represents the height that is retrieved or the height to set.

The default value as defined to the property system is a calculated value based on taking a one-third fraction of the system max screen height parameters, but this default is potentially overridden by various control templates.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.MaxDropDownHeight*> dependency property.
To be added.
Called when <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate*> is called.

Provides an appropriate <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ComboBoxAutomationPeer"></xref> implementation for this control, as part of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure.
The type-specific <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> implementation.
Reports when a combo box's popup closes.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.DropDownClosed"></xref> event.
Reports when a combo box's popup opens.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.DropDownOpened"></xref> event.
Reports that the <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsKeyboardFocusWithin*> property changed.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.IsKeyboardFocusWithinChanged"></xref> event.
Called when the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsMouseCaptured*> property changes.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.IsMouseCapturedChanged"></xref> event.
Invoked when a <xref:System.Windows.Input.Keyboard.KeyDown> attached routed event occurs.
Event data.
Called to report that the left mouse button was released.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseLeftButtonUp"></xref> event.
Invoked when a <xref:System.Windows.Input.Keyboard.PreviewKeyDown> attached routed event occurs.
Event data.
Responds to a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox"></xref> selection change by raising a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectionChanged"></xref> event.
Provides data for <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.SelectionChangedEventArgs"></xref>.
Prepares the specified element to display the specified item.
Preparing the element may involve applying styles, setting bindings, and so on.
Element used to display the specified item.
Specified item.
Gets the item that is displayed in the selection box.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> uses this property to show the selected item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.

To get the selected item of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> outside of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedItem%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property instead of this property.

The selected item.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.SelectionBoxItem*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets a composite string that specifies how to format the selected item in the selection box if it is displayed as a string.
A composite string that specifies how to format the selected item in the selection box if it is displayed as a string.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.SelectionBoxItemStringFormat*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets the item template of the selection box content.
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
An item template.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.SelectionBoxItemTemplate*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox"></xref> keeps the user's input or replaces the input with a matching item.
By default, when the user types a string into the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> that matches one of its items, the item is selected and the text that the user typed is replaced.
This can cause the text that the user entered to change case.
If the ShouldPreserveUserEnteredPrefix property is set to `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> selects the matching item, but preserves the text that the user entered.
For example, suppose that a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> contains the string, "Hello" (with a capital H) and the user enters "hello" (with a lowercase h).
If ShouldPreserveUserEnteredPrefix is `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> selects the matching item, "Hello," in its collection and populates its text box with that string.
If ShouldPreserveUserEnteredPrefix is `true`, "Hello" is selected from the collection, but the text box says "hello."
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox"></xref> keeps the user's input; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox"></xref> replaces the input with a matching item The registered default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.ShouldPreserveUserEnteredPrefix*> dependency property.
To be added.

Gets or sets whether a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox"></xref> that is open and displays a drop-down control will remain open when a user clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TextBox"></xref>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to keep the drop-down control open when the user clicks on the text area to start editing; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.StaysOpenOnEdit*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the text of the currently selected item.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsEditable%2A> property is `true`, setting this property places initial text entered in the text box.
When <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.IsEditable%2A> is `false`, setting this value has no effect.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|, |
The string of the currently selected item.
The default is an empty string ("").
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox.Text*> dependency property.
To be added.
